title: Uh... No it doesn't.
body: Noticed this on a recent game.

replies.body:
RIP Zeke's Herald

I loved playing AD Janna Support.
They seriously should have left it as two seperate items.. "no one builds it" So? Obviously people did build it lol, what harm did leaving it in the game do?

This! It was such a fun item! All be it meta golem was ridiculous xD But with all the tank busting going on out there it wouldnt be a problem. I think it'd be cool to have more items that give strength through other stats other than straight ad or ap. You know kinda like tear of the godess items scale off of mana, and atma's scaled really low off of health.. but it was something! That was diversity!

I just think that they need an AD Support to actually allow those items though, I've tried a few like AD Janna (I had 15 stacks of Sword, Zeke's, and Ardent, pretty scary) but it just doesn't feel right. It 's really nice to know that I can fend myself for a bit, and also provide great utility for my team though.

Someone posted an idea about a Sapper themed AD Support a while ago. Would be pretty interesting.

Zeke's Herald never gave AD, only +20% cooldown reduction and +250 health. You're losing two stats and gaining a compositional passive, since only your ADC and maybe one other laner will have the need for life-steal and AD. Zeke's Herald was sub-par on any champion, it's not whether it was built - but should even be in the game? Why would you get it? When you're stomping? I can just get a Frozen Heart to have a better effect on the teamfight or trades. When I'm behind? The support starts already build into great items for struggling supports, that also increase gold gain.

AD supports are a good idea, but Zeke's Herald was just useless - perhaps if gave the wearer the aura effect, but it didn't.
Um, it did give you the effect ya noob xD

Zeke's Herald built out of AD items.

Also, Zeke's Herald actually worked on Yorick a bit since they would recieve the buffs.

But ardent doesn't buff Janna >_> It only buffs your adc.
Can't be worse than old Zeke's.

20 free ad + 10% lifesteal aura and 10% cdr and 250 health with less cost that is permanently available sounds alot better to me than a aura that is sometimes there when you need it and sometimes not.

An item with an active phase useful for a either a mage or an AD carry sounds much more versatile and usable than 20 free ad and 10% lifesteal, meaning the only people who can really make good use of it are sieging carries.

u say it a phase that lasts 6 seconds a mini time window it activates upon reaching 100 stacks and then it gets immediately wasted you can get maybe 1 spell and 1 or 3 autoattacks off . and you might not even critt at all.
